posts.author: MemeWarsVet
posts.title: Bruh.

posts.raw_content: Wife and I spent ten days in Tennessee for her birthday and to see if we want to live there, Nashville, Knoxville and Gatlinburg and the surrounding areas of each to get a feel for the areas. Nashville is trash and I mean hot fucking trash. Nashville is like country music meets the Kardashians with a big dash of tranny shit tossed in. Fucking drag queen tours, troons walking about and prices on par with NewYork. It was literally a gayer version of Vegas minus the casinos.  I can not begin to describe how impossible it should be to have a miserable time with drunken college age and milf age women dressed skimpy walking about but Nashville has done it in spades. The only saving grace was unlike other tourist destinations I have been to no one was shot or stabbed which I credit the demographics alone for. But like most metros the ghetto is literally just outside the area. The only shining beacon was a steak house in the affluent area which the patrons didn't seem to happy for us to eat in called Sperry's belle Mede, To be fair even though I and the wife have done well for ourselves we don't dress the part because fuck a suit and tie. Retro rifle shirts and cargo shorts are about all ill wear (the mohawk probably doesn't help either). Knoxville was ok but not what we were looking for but the people in the surrounding areas were nice and accommodating. Eastern Tennessee however is beautiful, People still speak like they did when I was growing up in Georgia, kind of made me feel nostalgic. Trump flags everywhere, I didn't see a single drag queen or troon though  I am sure they are there just not celebrated Sevierville and the surrounding areas make the mountains look like a fucking Norman Rockwell painting. Gatlinburg never disappoints but its too crowded to live in. I think we are going to eastern Tennessee . Also went for a day in Kentucky for the ark experience lovely area and beautiful but the economy there is non existent.

posts.raw_content:
To follow up on an earlier post.  I had my "pre" interview.

It went pretty good I think.  I am 90% certain I will get a follow up real interview.  I still think I can do the job, I would like the opportunity to prove myself.  It is only 5.5 miles from my house.  7-3:30 MTWT and 7-12:30 on Fridays.  The plant is closed on Fridays but it will be my job to bring in contractors for repairs and maintenance.  I also deal with hazardous waste and non hazardous waste disposal, shipping, receiving and inventory.

The cons.  It is a little more office work than I had anticipated.  Probably 70 %.  In my business I paid someone to do my quick books.  It's not that I was unable to do it.  But I was valuable on the floor.  I would average $200-$400 an hour so I could afford an office manager.  So that is a hit against me.  But I am pretty sure I can learn Microsoft office and QuickBooks in a few weeks.  It's not like I don't have computer skills.  While they said it wasn't a deal breaker that is my weak spot.  Everything else I should flow seamlessly into.  

It sounds like my final interview will be with the owners around Wednesday.  I actually go to the plant and take the tour and see everything the job entails.  We just got the small stuff out of the way today.  

Hopefully, the job is still mine.  I know I made a positive impression. The systems are all in place so it isn't like I have to create something from scratch.  I just need to learn them.  

40 hours of sick leave and one week of vacation after 90 days.  Two weeks of vacation after one year and three weeks and 40 hours of sick leave after six years.  Vacation can be taken by the hour.  They have matching 401K and profit sharing.  Not sure how good the insurance is but it is medical, vision and dental.   

Still need the luck but I am gonna keep looking just in case.  I'm not one to put all my eggs in one basket.  

I don't need to go to work yet.  I have enough put away to go another two years.  But that puts me at Wal-Mart Greeter age.
posts.title: This old fart had his preliminary interview.  This is how it went.
posts.content:
To follow up on an earlier post. I had my "pre" interview.

It went pretty good I think. I am 90% certain I will get a follow up real interview. I still think I can do the job, I would like the opportunity to prove myself. It is only 5.5 miles from my house. 7-3:30 MTWT and 7-12:30 on Fridays. The plant is closed on Fridays but it will be my job to bring in contractors for repairs and maintenance. I also deal with hazardous waste and non hazardous waste disposal, shipping, receiving and inventory.

The cons. It is a little more office work than I had anticipated. Probably 70 %. In my business I paid someone to do my quick books. It's not that I was unable to do it. But I was valuable on the floor. I would average $200-$400 an hour so I could afford an office manager. So that is a hit against me. But I am pretty sure I can learn Microsoft office and QuickBooks in a few weeks. It's not like I don't have computer skills. While they said it wasn't a deal breaker that is my weak spot. Everything else I should flow seamlessly into.

It sounds like my final interview will be with the owners around Wednesday. I actually go to the plant and take the tour and see everything the job entails. We just got the small stuff out of the way today.

Hopefully, the job is still mine. I know I made a positive impression. The systems are all in place so it isn't like I have to create something from scratch. I just need to learn them.

40 hours of sick leave and one week of vacation after 90 days. Two weeks of vacation after one year and three weeks and 40 hours of sick leave after six years. Vacation can be taken by the hour. They have matching 401K and profit sharing. Not sure how good the insurance is but it is medical, vision and dental.

Still need the luck but I am gonna keep looking just in case. I'm not one to put all my eggs in one basket.

I don't need to go to work yet. I have enough put away to go another two years. But that puts me at Wal-Mart Greeter age.
